paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants and penetrance data related to hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

patients.demographics: Age range 30-70 years, both male and female

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 42 and presented with significant sensory loss.
Patient P2 was diagnosed at age 49 with motor involvement.
Patient P3, evaluated at age 38, showed no symptoms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Mild symptoms, not meeting diagnostic criteria
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P4 had mild symptoms but did not meet diagnostic criteria.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicated altered protein stability and aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, observed in multiple affected family members.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family studies and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The Val40Met variant is one of the most common mutations associated with ATTRv-PN.
key_quotes: The Val40Met mutation is associated with a significant risk of developing polyneuropathy.
Patients with this mutation often present with early onset symptoms.

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline demographics and disease characteristics in the OLE study

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variant and penetrance were successfully extracted.
